body:
I am not a fan of the humans.txt idea whatsoever. That’s what an about[/team|/site] page is for. If you don’t want to hyperlink to your about page, then fine… but it doesn’t make much sense to remove information meant for humans from the human-navigable web *as a standard*. It does for robots.txt because, guess what, humans aren’t supposed to see it.

If the point is that most people won’t see it, or team leads won't see it, or other secretive reasons, then why place it in a consistent, partially-discoverable manner?  Humans.txt is awkwardly halfway between easter egg and about page.

tl;dr: why hurt discoverability on purpose?
